properties.spotName: Chess table on Burke-Gilman trail, Fremont
properties.spotDesc: Runners, walkers and cyclists passing in front and behind. View of the water.

properties.spotName: Picnic table under the trees southeast of the reservoir in Volunteer Park
properties.spotDesc: View of the various evergreens across the reservoir, park goers walking on the path to the north. Sunlit when the sun is low in the south/east, well shaded thereafter.

properties.spotName: Metal table in the shade of a tree at Lake Union park
properties.spotDesc: Directly west of the Center for Wooden Boats. View of MOHAI, a sliver of Lake Union to the north. Lake goers everywhere. Space Needle and afternoon sun mostly obscured by the tree. One of the more shaded of similar tables in the area.

properties.spotName: Post Alley Park
properties.spotDesc: Small section off Post Alley past the gum wall. Two picnic tables, often busy during the day, many passing tourists. Closed at 9pm.

properties.spotName: Plaza next to the Omeron building off Elliott Ave, outside Gourmondo Cafe
properties.spotDesc: A dozen or so tables, not usually very busy or well shaded. View of Elliott Bay! There are outlets in the garden beds under the trees near the cafe. Very close to the train tracks.

properties.spotName: Picnic tables in the U District off the Burke-Gilman Trail
properties.spotDesc: Three tables, two of which are mostly unshaded except for late in the day. Passing bicyclists and the dull sound of cars on the road.

properties.spotName: Picnic table in Magnuson Park
properties.spotDesc: Apart from the other reservable picnic tables for grilling, in the shade of a maple tree. The waves of Lake Washington roll on tiny pebble beaches mere feet away with walkers passing on the nearby path. Restrooms nearby.

properties.spotName: Three tables in Urban Triangle Park on Lenora and 8th
properties.spotDesc: A busy spot nestled between tall buildings on the edges of Belltown/SLU.

properties.spotName: Picnic table in the northern part of the Arboretum
properties.spotDesc: Under the shade of a large oak tree. The table is slightly decayed and a little wobbly. Cars go by on the nearby road.

properties.spotName: Table and chairs in Cascade Park
properties.spotDesc: Three tables with chairs, some less useable than others, in the shade of some oak trees. Next to a community garden and a foosball table.

properties.spotName: Picnic tables in Roanoke Park
properties.spotDesc: Six tables, two each on either side of a large white elm, two nearer the play structure under firs. Sound of I-5 just to the west, mostly well shaded.

properties.spotName: Tables beneath the I-5 bridge, South Passage Point Park
properties.spotDesc: Two tables, unshaded except by the bridge. Roar of the highway above a kind of pink noise. Boaters, rowers, paddlers passing on the water. Can be breezy.

properties.spotName: Table in Good Turn Park, Eastlake
properties.spotDesc: Solitary table, well shaded. Right next to the water.

properties.spotName: Table on the edge of Fairview Park, Eastlake
properties.spotDesc: A solitary table in the afternoon sun. View of the water, small grassy patch of the park.

properties.spotName: Long table on west side of Cal Anderson park
properties.spotDesc: One long table with six seats in the shade of an Oak tree, with a view mostly the south end of the park. Incidentally, also good for making protest signs.

properties.spotName: Table near the water in Eastlake Boulodrome Park
properties.spotDesc: Feet from the gently lapping water, in the shade of a tree. View of the lake and Queen Anne between the houseboats.

properties.spotName: Table off the Elliot Bay Trail
properties.spotDesc: Lots of sun, sounds of ships being loaded nearby. Not much of a view as trees obscure the bay mostly. Bikers passing close. Table is porus, so be sure to have a thick surface to write on.

properties.spotName: Picnic table in the northern part of Volunteer Park
properties.spotDesc: In the shade of some massive trees, away from the busier sections of the park.

properties.spotName: Tables in Denny Park
properties.spotDesc: Several groups of tables and chairs, variously shaded, but mostly unshaded midday. Fairly quiet, even on a weekday. View of the Space Needle from the right angle.

properties.spotName: Table off the Burke Gilman trail near Seaview Picnic Park in Ballard
properties.spotDesc: Some road noise and lots of sun, view of the bushes above the public shore. Very close to someone's driveway.

properties.spotName: Picnic tables on the south entrance of Carkeek Park
properties.spotDesc: Just inside the park, semi shaded and with motor sound of 100th ave nearby.

properties.spotName: Table in the sculpture park, off the Elliott Bay Trail
properties.spotDesc: A single tree provides some shade, mostly later in the day. View of the bay, people passing on the trail on either side.

properties.spotName: Shaded picnic table in Volunteer Park
properties.spotDesc: Under a large maple and surrounded by several other trees; very shaded. Picnickers in the grass nearby, home to some of the bolder squirrels.

properties.spotName: Six tables in Bell St. Park, Belltown
properties.spotDesc: Three large and three small tables, shaded by buildings towards the afternoon.

properties.spotName: Table at the end of the Elliot Bay Trail
properties.spotDesc: Surrounded by industry, with passing trains and fishing boats on Pier 90 nearby, and rabbits in the evening.

properties.spotName: Picnic tables along the Mts to Sound Greenway, Judkins Park
properties.spotDesc: Three tables right off the path, getting lots of afternoon sun from the south. Looking out over Jimi Hendrix Park and the NW African American Museum.

properties.spotName: Solitary table in Volunteer Park
properties.spotDesc: Shaded under a large oak, people passing on the path. Table is a bit wobbly.

properties.spotName: Tables in Arcade Square in Capitol Hill
properties.spotDesc: Five tables, three low ones with seats, surrounded by ping-pong tables and cornhole games. Few people except for Carmelo's Tacos eaters, cars passing all around, view down Denny towards downtown.

properties.spotName: Metal tables near the statue of Lenin in Fremont
properties.spotDesc: Partial shade, tables are maybe technically for patrons of the nearby sandwich shops, but who's asking. Bring a flat surface to write on while you contemplate what is to be done.

properties.spotName: Tables and chairs on the new Pier 62
properties.spotDesc: A dozen or so tables in full sun, view of downtown and the waterfront, Elliott Bay and the Olympic range.

properties.spotName: Hidden table in a grove in Volunteer Park
properties.spotDesc: Secluded behind the Asian Art museum, plentiful shade. Old, uneven surface with gaps, fyi.

properties.spotName: Tables and chairs in Westlake Park, downtown
properties.spotDesc: A dozen or so tables, often food trucks, pigeons, chess players, skateboarders, the buzz of downtown. Shade depending on buildings/if your table is one of ~5 under trees. Sometimes music playing.

properties.spotName: Tables and chairs in McGraw Park, downtown
properties.spotDesc: About a half dozen tables, near the Westlake street car stop and the monorail. Shade dependent on buildings.

properties.spotName: Lone table off the Loop Trail in Discovery Park
properties.spotDesc: Views of the water, lots of sun, some hikers and runners passing fairly frequently.

properties.spotName: Lone table deep in Freeway Park
properties.spotDesc: Apart from some of the other tables, partially shaded. The highway drones behind you.

properties.spotName: Tables in the main plaza of Freeway Park
properties.spotDesc: Porous surfaces! But under a lovely oak and maple.

properties.spotName: Single table in W McGraw St end/Shoreline St end, Magnolia
properties.spotDesc: For a more solitary choice. Spectacular views of Elliott bay, Puget Sound, Mt Rainier.

properties.spotName: Table on the Seattle University Campus
properties.spotDesc: After 11th Ave ends at Madison, continue to this small space between university buildings. Relatively quiet.

properties.spotName: Tables in 12th Ave Park
properties.spotDesc: Four tables plus a long picnic table, no shade, right off 12th Ave. Some lighting for Nite Writing.

properties.spotName: Tables in Tilikum Place, Belltown
properties.spotDesc: Looking down Cedar to the bay, cars and the occasional monorail passing near. Might be for customers at the nearby 5 Point Cafe, but, forgiveness not permission, right?

properties.spotName: Thirteen small tables in Seattle Center, just below the Space Needle
properties.spotDesc: Unshaded, overlooks the green lawn, fountain.

properties.spotName: Two tables outside Theo Chocolate in Fremont
properties.spotDesc: A little bit of shade from the trees off Phinney, not a far walk from the water or coffee on 35th.

properties.spotName: Single table in Spruce St. Mini Park, Central District
properties.spotDesc: Shaded by several large trees in the afternoon in a quiet neighborhood.

properties.spotName: Tables in Occidental square, Pioneer Square
properties.spotDesc: Over a dozen tables surrounded by the sounds of ping-pong, underground tours, chess games. Well shaded but not dark, cafes and ivy covered brick all around.

properties.spotName: Several tables in UPS Waterfall Park, Pioneer Square
properties.spotDesc: The waterfall is loud enough to drown out most other noise, if that's your thing. Well shaded and partially covered. Hours 8-5:45 summer, 8-3:45 winter.

properties.spotName: Umbrella tables inside of Pike Place Market, downtown
properties.spotDesc: Might be hard to get some seating, but much easier once the market closes. Incredible views of Elliot Bay, the waterfront, the Olympics and Mt Rainier.

properties.spotName: Public Atrium at 1201 3rd
properties.spotDesc: Right off University stop. Many reading chairs in the main area, plus some stools and tables around the floor above. Outlets, long tables, even a few muted TVs. Quiet aside from the trickling of the water sculpture.

properties.spotName: 7th floor of the 4th and Madison building
properties.spotDesc: Take the 'podium elevators' in the west corner of the 4th floor or to the right from the 3rd ave entrance. A dozen tables, uncovered with a 3/4 surrounding city view. Mon-Fri, 7a-5:30p.

properties.spotName: Market in Century Square, downtown
properties.spotDesc: Go past the escalators. Inside, with outlets! Ten or so lighted tables, plus three long tables with stools and several armchairs and couches. Nearby lunch restaurants too. Note: this is a privately owned public space (POPS), listed on http://Seattle.gov’s list of such places, though the market rules placard says otherwise. 1501 4th Ave, Seattle WA 98101

properties.spotName: Table in Hiawatha play field, West Seattle
properties.spotDesc: Shade later in the day, the sound of kids on swings nearby.

properties.spotName: Tables at 3rd and Spring, Downtown
properties.spotDesc: Half dozen tables tucked between some sandwich shops and tall buildings, shaded in the afternoon. No obvious #POPS sign but on http://seattle.gov’s list of privately owned public spaces. 1111 3rd Ave, Seattle WA 98101. Weekdays only

properties.spotName: Tables off the play field in Cal Anderson park, Capitol Hill
properties.spotDesc: Next to a garden and public restrooms, unshaded.

properties.spotName: Lone table in Ravenna Park
properties.spotDesc: Under the shade of a large maple, the sounds of the creek audible.

properties.spotName: Table under a willow in Seward Park
properties.spotDesc: Walkers and joggers pass on one side while the water laps on the shore. There's a makeshift rope swing if you're feeling adventurous.

properties.spotName: Tables off Western Ave in Pike Place Market
properties.spotDesc: View of the Great Wheel and the Olympics, lots of sun (if it's out!).

properties.spotName: Tables and chairs in Pacific Place, downtown
properties.spotDesc: Some tables with outlets, chairs, amid the sounds of the mall. Lots of light from the skylight above, plus WiFi. Not on any POPS list but also no purchase necessary as far as I can tell!

properties.spotName: Shaded table off the Duwamish trail, West Seattle
properties.spotDesc: A view of the city over the calm waterway, some traffic sounds. More tables nearby in həʔapus Village Park.

properties.spotName: Two tables under a willow near UW south campus
properties.spotDesc: Right on Portage Bay, looking out over the water to the neighborhood of the same name. Boats going by and rolling their wake onto the shore. Shaded mostly.
